body:
### Problem

I'm not sure if this is a problem only with pylsp.pylint diagnostic or a general problem.

From this state
```py
I      ■ [missing-module-docstring] Missing module docstring

I def foo():     ■ [disallowed-name] Disallowed name "foo"
      pass
``` 
By entering insert mode and adding a newline and then exit insert mode. the diagnostics will update to look like below:
```py
I      ■ [missing-module-docstring] Missing module docstring

I      ■ [disallowed-name] Disallowed name "foo"
W def foo():     ■ E303 too many blank lines (3)
      pass
```

As you can see the `[disallowed-name]` diagnostic from pylint is on the wrong line now. Also if the cursor is on this line and we try to execute `lua vim.diagnostic.goto_prev()`, nothing will happen.

### Steps to reproduce

config:

```vim
Plug 'neovim/nvim-lspconfig'
lua local lsp = require('lspconfig')
lua lsp.pylsp.setup { settings = { pylsp = { plugins = { pylint = { enabled = true }}}}}
```

### Expected behavior

goto_prev to not "hang" even if the diagnostic position is incorrect

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.9.4

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A?

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 22.04

### Terminal name/version

wezterm over ssh

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

download and unpack linux64 tar.gz release
title: When lsp diagnostics are on wrong line, goto_prev stops working
